intro: Castanopsis tibetana, commonly known as the Tibetan chestnut. It is a deciduous evergreen tree native to the high altitude regions of Tibet. The plant belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and have a dark green upper surface. The tree produces small, edible nuts enclosed in a spiny husk, which are an important food source for local wildlife.
